title: Price above LR equilibrium, new firms will enter

content.description: The following problems refer to the graph below for a representative firm in a perfectly competitive, constant-cost industry, which shows the firmâ€™s marginal cost (MC), average total cost (ATC), and average variable cost (AVC).
content.question: Which of the following MUST be true in the long run?

choices.label: The equilibrium price will be P2, since that is where marginal cost equals minimum average variable cost.
The equilibrium price will be above P3, since firms must make an economic profit to stay in business.
If the price is above P2, new firms will enter the industry.
If the price is above P3, new firms will enter the industry.
If the price is above P4, firms will exit the industry.

content.answer: If the price is above P3, new firms will enter the industry.
